trial_identification.studytitle: Treating cannabis problems by the mail and the internet
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Members of the public with problem cannabis use will access Cognitive-Behavioral Therapy in hard copy and electronic formats using wait list contols to help moderate or cease their cannabis use.

interventions.interventions: Cognitive Behavioral Therapy as bibliotherapy in six manuals delivered at two weekly intervals, concentrating on motivational enhancement, learning skills to deal with cues promoting drug use, emotional management without drugs and developing problem solving skills.
interventions.comparator: Wait list interval 3 months is equivalent to the duration of the therapy.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Comprehensive self report assessments at recruitment, end of wait interval (controls only), end of program and follow ups three and six months after the end of treatment.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Reduced psychological distress, in particular levels of anxiety and depression as assessed by the Kessler Psychological Distress Scale (K10).
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Comprehensive self report assessments at recruitment, end of wait interval (controls only), end of program and follow ups three and six months after the end of treatment.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Acknowledgement of a problem with cannabis use
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Current major psychiatric diagnosis, pregnancy or inability to read and write English adequately.

trial_design.concealment: Upon completing and returning the initial self assessment, subjects are assigned as follows: The data entry operator requests the next assignment from a table of assignment codes (see below) corresponding to the sex of the subject. By entering the subject's unique ID code, that assignment is exhausted and will not reappear.
trial_design.sequence: Two tables of group assignments were generated by randomising the order of blocks of assignment codes. One table were thus randomised for each sex, totalling twice the number of assignments planned for recruitment.
trial_design.designfeatures: The wait list control subjects begin the intervention after waiting the length of time required to complete the intervention (three months).

othercollaborator.othercollaboratorname: National Drug and Alcohol Research Centre

ethicsAndSummary.summary: A trial of the efficacy of a Cognitivie Behavioral Therapy intervention delivered by post for problem cannabis use to reduce or eliminate cannabis use and reduce psychological disturbance where this is also a problem.
